title: Create a Professional Resume
headline: Go job-hunting with new confidence and a professional resume that we show you how to polish in this free online course.
description: This free online course helps you organize your resume and guides you through the stressful job-seeking process. We lay out the essential components of a resume in detail before examining different formats you can use to highlight your strengths. We go through appropriate action verbs that have proven to improve applicants’ chances and highlight common pitfalls and mistakes that might hold you back.
courseDescription:
This free online course takes you through the professional method of writing a well-organized resume. We break down each step in writing an effective curriculum vitae (CV), its basic components, action verbs, keywords and more. We show you how to choose keywords and appropriate action words. A resume is an essential tool for job-seeking because it provides an opportunity to showcase your education, skills and qualities in order to get that first interview. They also help employers make wise hiring decisions.

In today’s competitive job market, a well-organized resume is a basic requirement and can set you apart from the competition. A polished document shows employers that the candidate is serious and a good fit for the job. Your CV describes your qualifications and what makes you unique. To stand out among other applicants, you need one that markets your strengths and matches the offered job. A good resume grabs the attention of employers and recruiters, sells your skills and accomplishments, shows how you’re a match for the position - and gets you a job interview.

This explains why learning how to structure your resume and choosing what information to include are essential to job-hunting. This free online course teaches how to polish your CV and goes through proven tips that can help you make your next career move. A good resume can make the difference between success and failure so sign up to make the most of yours and open new doors of opportunity.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Explain the requirements for creating a perfect resume
    • Recall how to write a professional resume
    • Describe the different components of a resume
    • Select appropriate action words
    • Categorize the different format types of resumes
    • Arrange content in perfect format

  • Welcome Note

  • In this short class, we will discuss “How to write the professionally organized resume that will get you an interview (at least).

    A resume is the first thing that you need to apply for a job and having a perfectly organized resume differentiates you from the candidate pool. Your resume helps employers to know more about you before inviting you for the job interview. It describes your work experience, your education, your skills that are beneficial for your future employer.

    Purpose of a Resume

    Without a resume, it is nearly impossible to compete with the hundreds of other candidates applying for the same job. So, the primary purpose of your resume is to lend you to a job interview, where you can show an employer who are you and why are you the perfect match for the job. My resume helped me to contact many clients not only in India but all around the world. Having a great resume means having several job offers.

    Now let begins………………

  • Making a Perfect Resume

  • Making a Perfect Resume

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Making a Perfect Resume

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module, you have learned how to create a resume that will present your experience and skills effectively and concisely. Here are some of the key points:
    •  A resume is a professionally written summary of your qualifications and employment experience.
    • Your resume is an important tool for getting an employer's attention, it is used to share details about your skills, and its purpose is to get you to a job interview stage. 
    • An applicant should focus on presenting the most relevant information on one page. It is important to have a concise resume, where you tell the employer how you can help them grow their business. Bullet points are often used. 
    • Key components of a resume are name and contact details, heading and summary, work experience, and education. 
    • Resume keywords are important because of the applicant tracking system (ATS) software, which many employers use to organize large numbers of applicant resumes. 
    • The headline is very important, as it shows your professional strengths related to the position you are applying for. 
    • Professional experience lands on the third part of the resume. Here you describe your current and past job duties. This is one of the most important parts of the resume.
